results.title: Southeast Asia: Malaysia and Singapore
results.brief_description: Most of the people in Malaysia are farmers, fishermen or miners. Most of the people of Singapore are merchants, importers and exporters, or factory workers. In both countries most of the people are Malay, Chinese, Indian and Pakistani. But in spite of the ethnic similarities, Malaysia and Singapore are strikingly different.

results.title: Southeast Asia: Burma and Thailand
results.brief_description: Burma and Thailand are similar in their geography and in the ways of life of their people. Old traditions guide much of the life of the people of both countries. However, both Rangoon and Bangkok are modern-looking. This film examines the similarities of the two countries.

results.title: South: Sir Ernest Shackleton's glorious epic....
results.brief_description: Photographed by Frank Hurley, ‘South’ is the film record of Sir Ernest Shackleton’s heroic but ill-starred attempt to cross Antarctica in 1914-16. It is both a historical document, and a tribute to the indomitable courage of the 28 men who set out on a voyage of discovery that turned into an epic struggle for survival. Silent with original music by Neil Brand.

results.title: South with Shackleton (1914)
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Richard Robinson
results.brief_description: Follows the trials and tribulations of the unsuccessful exploration team of Sir Ernest Shackleton which set off from South America aboard the “Endurance” to sail to the Antarctic via South Georgia Island. After 9 weeks at sea, the ship was caught by an ice pack and frozen in. Uses archival footage, comments by surviving team members and original film footage taken by Frank Hurley. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: South west symphony
results.creator_credit: Cinesound for the Tourist Development Authority of Victoria and Keith Gow
results.brief_description: A lyrical account of the scenic beauties of Victoria’s south west coastal region. Beginning with aerial shots and street scenes of the city of Melbourne and ending at historical Portland. Also visits many of the higlights along the Great Ocean Road, including Geelong, Lorne, Warrnambool and the 12 apostles. Cinematography by Ross King. Narrated by Len London. (Awards: AFI Silver award 1965 Travel Category)

results.title: South Pacific island children: life in Fiji
results.brief_description: Family life on one of the largest islands of the Fiji Group. Shows members of a native family at a variety of daily activities - fishing, gardening, attending school and constructing a house. Also indicates the importance of the coconut palm to the islanders and shows a fish drive followed by a feast.

results.title: South of France
results.brief_description: A practical guide for people intending to travel the South of France. Host John Guerassio begins in the Provence region, visiting Avignon, Arles, Camarge, Stes-Maries-De-La-Mer, Vaucluse, and Gard. From here he travels to the French Riviera to appraise Nice, Cannes, Mougins, St Paul, Biot, St Raphael, St Tropez and Pramousquier. He recommends quiet and remote beaches in the region for those wishing to escape the crowds. Provides advice on public transport options, budget and deluxe hotels, money saving tips, food and wine. Includes shopping advice for antiques, lace and hand blown glass.

results.title: South Mysore
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India and AMA
results.brief_description: An American family holidaying in Bangalor and the surrounding district. The tourist facilities; Mysore City; the palaces, markets and temples; street entertainers, formal gardens, festivals, visits to game reserves; the Jain monuments; local customs and folk dances.

results.title: South East Asia
results.brief_description: A survey of the industry and commerce of Burma, Indo-China, Thailand and Malaya where ancient methods and modes of life contrast sharply with new machinery, schools, highways, modern factories and scientific farming methods. Explains that rice is the basic food crop of the area, and it is also exported in quantities to other countries. Other products include tin, oil, crude rubber and teak.

results.title: South Canterbury
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Soil Conservation and Rivers Control Council
results.brief_description: Shows problems of floods, and soil erosion in one catchment area. Explains how public authorities brought the rivers under control, and took measures for soil conservation.
